name: Yamaha AEROX 155
meta_title: Yamaha Aerox 155 – 155cc Liquid-Cooled Scooter with Traction Control
meta_description: Explore Yamaha Aerox 155: 0-60 in 3.4s, Bluetooth, traction control & LED lights. Best-in-class maxi-scooter for urban riders.
short_description: Yamaha Aerox 155 - The ultimate 155cc maxi-scooter with liquid-cooled engine, VVA technology, and Bluetooth connectivity. Experience sporty urban rides with best-in-class features including traction control and LED lighting.

pros: Sporty performance with quick acceleration (0-60kmph in 3.4s)
Advanced features like traction control and Bluetooth
Liquid-cooled engine for better heat management
LED lighting package for better visibility
cons: Small 5.5L fuel tank limits touring range
Drum brake at rear lacks stopping power

faqs.question: How fast does Aerox 155 accelerate?
faqs.answer: Aerox 155 does 0-60 kmph in 3.4 seconds and 0-100 kmph in 7.4 seconds.

faqs.question: Is Aerox 155 good for tall riders?
faqs.answer: Yes, its 790mm seat height accommodates most riders comfortably.

faqs.question: What makes Aerox different from other scooters?
faqs.answer: It offers premium features like traction control and liquid cooling uncommon in scooters.

faqs.question: Can two adults ride comfortably?
faqs.answer: Yes, but the seat is slightly narrow for wider passengers.

name: Yamaha Fazer Fi V2
meta_title: Yamaha Fazer Fi V2 – 149cc Fuel-Injected Street Bike
meta_description: Yamaha Fazer Fi V2 offers 45–48 kmpl mileage, LED DRLs & smooth 5-speed ride. Ideal for daily commuters in Bangladesh.
short_description: Yamaha Fazer Fi V2 - The stylish 149cc street bike with fuel injection, delivering 50kmpl mileage. Perfect balance of performance and efficiency for daily commuters.

faqs.question: What is Fazer Fi V2's acceleration time?
faqs.answer: It accelerates 0-60 kmph in 4.8 seconds and 0-100 kmph in 12.2 seconds.

faqs.question: Is it suitable for highway rides?
faqs.answer: Yes, but best for city commuting with occasional highway use up to 100kmph.

faqs.question: Does it have tubeless tires?
faqs.answer: Yes, both front and rear tires are tubeless.

faqs.question: What's the service interval?
faqs.answer: Recommended service every 3000km or 3 months.

name: Yamaha FZ 25
meta_title: Yamaha FZ 25 – 249cc Dual-ABS Street Motorcycle
meta_description: Powerful Yamaha FZ 25 with 20.6 PS, dual-channel ABS & 35–38 kmpl. Perfect for city and highway rides.
short_description: Yamaha FZ 25 - The powerful 249cc street motorcycle with muscular styling and dual-channel ABS. Perfect for riders seeking performance and safety in city and highway conditions.
pros: Good mid-range torque for city riding
cons: Air-cooled engine heats up in traffic
Basic instrument console without gear indicator
No fuel gauge (only low fuel warning)

faqs.question: How quick is FZ 25's acceleration?
faqs.answer: It does 0-60 kmph in 3.8 seconds and 0-100 kmph in 9.6 seconds.

faqs.question: Does it have ABS?
faqs.answer: Yes, dual-channel ABS comes as standard.

faqs.question: What's the highway cruising speed?
faqs.answer: Comfortable at 90-100 kmph with some vibrations at higher speeds.

faqs.question: Is it suitable for tall riders?
faqs.answer: Yes, the 795mm seat height accommodates most riders comfortably.

name: Yamaha FZ X
meta_title: Yamaha FZ X – Neo-Retro 149cc Street Bike with Bluetooth
meta_description: Yamaha FZ X blends scrambler style with Y-Connect Bluetooth, 42–45 kmpl & 810mm seat height for tall riders.
short_description: Yamaha FZ X - The neo-retro street bike with 149cc Blue Core engine, combining classic scrambler styling with modern features like LED lighting and smartphone connectivity.

image_urls.alt: YAMAH-FZ-X Yamaha Fz X Back View
YAMAH-FZ-X Yamaha Fz X Front View
YAMAH-FZ-X Yamaha Fz X Left View
YAMAH-FZ-X Yamaha Fz X Right View
YAMAH-FZ-X Yamaha Fz X Showroom View

faqs.question: How fast does FZ X accelerate?
faqs.answer: FZ X does 0-60 kmph in 4.6 seconds and 0-100 kmph in 11.8 seconds.

faqs.question: Is FZ X good for tall riders?
faqs.answer: Yes, its 810mm seat height suits taller riders comfortably.

faqs.question: Does it have ABS?
faqs.answer: Only the Deluxe variant comes with single-channel ABS.

faqs.question: What's special about FZ X design?
faqs.answer: It combines retro scrambler styling with modern features like LED lights and LCD display.

name: Yamaha FZS FI V4
meta_title: Yamaha FZS FI V4 – Dual-ABS 149cc with Y-Connect
meta_description: FZS FI V4: Dual-channel ABS, Bluetooth Y-Connect & 0-60 in 4.5s. Sporty, safe & connected urban street bike.
short_description: Yamaha FZS FI V4 - The sporty 149cc street bike with fuel injection, dual-channel ABS, and Y-Connect Bluetooth. Perfect balance of performance, safety, and connectivity for urban riders.
cons: Pillion seat could be more comfortable

faqs.question: What's FZS V4's acceleration performance?
faqs.answer: It does 0-60 kmph in 4.5 seconds and 0-100 kmph in 11.5 seconds.

faqs.question: Does it have dual-channel ABS?
faqs.answer: Yes, the V4 comes with dual-channel ABS as standard.

faqs.question: What features does Y-Connect provide?
faqs.answer: Includes call/SMS alerts, phone battery status, and maintenance alerts.

faqs.question: Is it suitable for highway rides?
faqs.answer: Yes, but best for city commuting with occasional highway use up to 100-110kmph.

name: Yamaha FZS V2
meta_title: Yamaha FZS V2 – Budget 149cc FI Street Bike
meta_description: Affordable Yamaha FZS V2 with fuel injection, LED lights & 45–47 kmpl. Great value for city commuting.
short_description: Yamaha FZS V2 - The value-packed 149cc street bike with muscular styling, fuel injection, and comfortable ergonomics. Ideal for budget-conscious riders seeking Yamaha reliability.

faqs.question: How quick is FZS V2's acceleration?
faqs.answer: It does 0-60 kmph in 4.9 seconds and 0-100 kmph in 12.5 seconds.

faqs.question: Is this model fuel injected?
faqs.answer: Yes, all FZS models come with fuel injection.

faqs.question: What's the main difference from V4?
faqs.answer: V2 lacks Bluetooth and has drum brake instead of disc at rear.

faqs.question: Is it good for daily commuting?
faqs.answer: Excellent for city use with comfortable ergonomics and good mileage.

name: Yamaha FZS V3 ABS
meta_title: Yamaha FZS V3 ABS – Safe 149cc with Front ABS
meta_description: FZS V3 ABS offers single-channel ABS, 45–48 kmpl & LED lighting. Balanced safety and efficiency for daily rides.
short_description: Yamaha FZS V3 ABS - The safety-focused 149cc street bike with single-channel ABS, muscular styling, and fuel-efficient Blue Core engine. Perfect for riders prioritizing braking performance.

image_urls.alt: YAMAHA-FZS-V3 Yamaha Fzs V3Bs6 Left View
YAMAHA-FZS-V3 Yamaha Fzs V3Bs6 Right View

faqs.question: How quick is FZS V3 ABS's acceleration?
faqs.answer: It does 0-60 kmph in 4.7 seconds and 0-100 kmph in 12.0 seconds.

faqs.question: Is the ABS single or dual-channel?
faqs.answer: This variant has single-channel ABS only on the front wheel.

faqs.question: What's different from FZS V4?
faqs.answer: V3 lacks Bluetooth connectivity and has a simpler instrument cluster.

faqs.question: Is it good for wet weather riding?
faqs.answer: Yes, the ABS provides better braking control in wet conditions.

name: Yamaha FZS V3 ABS (BS6)
meta_title: Yamaha FZS V3 ABS BS6 – Eco-Friendly 149cc Commuter
meta_description: BS6-compliant FZS V3 with OBD2, 46–49 kmpl & front ABS. Cleaner emissions without sacrificing Yamaha reliability.
short_description: Yamaha FZS V3 ABS BS6 - The eco-friendly 149cc street bike with BS6 compliance, single-channel ABS, and improved fuel efficiency. Meets latest emission norms without compromising performance.

image_urls.alt: YAMAHA-FZS-V3 Yamaha Fzs V3Bs6 Left View
YAMAHA-FZS-V3 Yamaha Fzs V3Bs6 Right View

cons: Slightly less power than BS4 version

faqs.question: What's different in BS6 version?
faqs.answer: Has updated emission system, slightly less power but better mileage than BS4.

faqs.question: Acceleration comparison to BS4?
faqs.answer: Marginally slower: 0-60 kmph in 4.8s vs 4.7s for BS4.

faqs.question: Is maintenance cost higher?
faqs.answer: Slightly higher due to BS6 components but more fuel efficient.

faqs.question: Does it have OBD2?
faqs.answer: Yes, BS6 compliance requires OBD2 diagnostics system.

name: Yamaha FZS V3 Deluxe
meta_title: Yamaha FZS V3 Deluxe – Premium Dual-Tone 149cc
meta_description: FZS V3 Deluxe features exclusive dual-tone paint, ABS & sporty ergonomics. Style meets substance in Yamaha’s street lineup.
short_description: Yamaha FZS V3 Deluxe - The premium 149cc street bike with dual-tone colors, single-channel ABS, and enhanced styling. Combines safety with head-turning aesthetics.

image_urls.alt: Yamaha FZS V3 Deluxe on showroom display with dual-tone matte finish
Yamaha FZS V3 Deluxe on showroom display with dual-tone matte finish

faqs.question: What makes Deluxe special?
faqs.answer: Gets premium paint schemes and graphics over standard V3.

faqs.question: Performance same as regular V3?
faqs.answer: Yes, identical 0-60kmph in 4.7s and 0-100kmph in 12.0s.

faqs.question: Does it have special badging?
faqs.answer: Yes, features 'Deluxe' branding on fuel tank.

faqs.question: Are parts more expensive?
faqs.answer: Only body panels cost more; mechanical parts same as standard.

name: Yamaha FZS V3 Vintage Edition
meta_title: Yamaha FZS V3 Vintage – Retro 149cc Limited Edition
meta_description: Limited-edition FZS V3 Vintage with classic colors, ABS & modern 149cc engine. Nostalgia meets reliability.
short_description: Yamaha FZS V3 Vintage Edition - The retro-styled 149cc street bike with classic colors, single-channel ABS, and nostalgic design elements. Modern engineering with old-school charm.

image_urls.alt: Yamaha FZS V3 Vintage Edition on showroom display with retro-inspired styling

pros: Good resale value for limited edition
cons: Vintage parts may be harder to replace

faqs.question: Is this a limited edition?
faqs.answer: Yes, produced in limited numbers with special colors.

faqs.question: Performance same as regular V3?
faqs.answer: Identical performance: 0-60kmph in 4.8s, 0-100kmph in 12.1s.

faqs.question: Does it have vintage badging?
faqs.answer: Yes, features special 'Vintage Edition' logos.

faqs.question: Are maintenance costs higher?
faqs.answer: No, same as standard FZS V3 except for special body panels.

name: Yamaha MT 15
meta_title: Yamaha MT-15 – Liquid-Cooled 155cc Streetfighter
meta_description: MT-15: R15-derived 155cc engine, 0-60 in 3.2s & aggressive naked styling. Urban dominance with Deltabox frame.
short_description: Yamaha MT-15 - The aggressive streetfighter with 155cc liquid-cooled engine from R15 lineage. Features Deltabox frame, VVA technology, and naked bike styling for urban dominance.

faqs.question: How quick is MT-15's acceleration?
faqs.answer: One of fastest in class: 0-60kmph in 3.2s and 0-100kmph in 7.1s.

faqs.question: Is it same engine as R15?
faqs.answer: Similar 155cc liquid-cooled engine but tuned for more low-end torque.

faqs.question: Does it have ABS?
faqs.answer: Only top variant comes with single-channel ABS.

faqs.question: Is it good for highway?
faqs.answer: Yes, 6th gear helps but small tank limits touring range.

name: Yamaha MT-15 Version 2.0
meta_title: Yamaha MT-15 V2 – USD Forks & Dual-ABS Streetfighter
meta_description: MT-15 V2 upgrades with USD forks, dual-channel ABS & 0-60 in 3.1s. Premium handling for the ultimate street ride.
short_description: Yamaha MT-15 Version 2.0 - The updated streetfighter with dual-channel ABS, USD forks, and new color options. Enhanced version of MT-15 with premium suspension and safety features.

image_urls.alt: Yamaha Mt v2 Left Side View

pros: USD front forks for better handling

faqs.question: What's new in Version 2.0?
faqs.answer: Adds USD forks, dual-channel ABS, and updated styling.

faqs.question: How much faster than previous?
faqs.answer: Marginally quicker: 0-60kmph in 3.1s vs 3.2s.

faqs.question: Does it have traction control?
faqs.answer: No, but dual-channel ABS improves safety.

faqs.question: Is the suspension better?
faqs.answer: Yes, USD forks offer improved handling and feedback.

faqs.question: How quick is R15 V3's acceleration?
faqs.answer: Very quick: 0-60kmph in 3.0s and 0-100kmph in 6.7s.

faqs.question: What's special about Dark Knight?
faqs.answer: Exclusive black color scheme with red accents.

faqs.question: Does it have ABS?
faqs.answer: Yes, comes with single-channel ABS.

faqs.question: Is it good for track days?
faqs.answer: Excellent for track with sporty ergonomics and quick-revving engine.

name: Yamaha R15 V3 Racing Blue
meta_title: Yamaha R15 V3 Racing Blue – Iconic 155cc Supersport
meta_description: R15 V3 in Yamaha’s legendary Racing Blue. 18.6 PS, VVA & 0-100 in 6.7s. Pure track DNA for the streets.

pros: VVA technology for better power delivery

faqs.answer: Identical performance: 0-60kmph in 3.0s, 0-100kmph in 6.7s.

faqs.question: What's special about Racing Blue?
faqs.answer: Features Yamaha's iconic blue-white race livery.

faqs.question: Does it have ABS?
faqs.answer: Yes, comes with single-channel ABS.

faqs.question: Is it good for beginners?
faqs.answer: Not ideal - aggressive ergonomics suit experienced riders.

name: Yamaha R15 V4
meta_title: Yamaha R15 V4 – Quick Shifter & Dual-ABS 155cc
meta_description: R15 V4: Quick shifter, dual-channel ABS, Y-Connect & 0-60 in 2.9s. The most advanced 155cc supersport yet.
short_description: Yamaha R15 V4 - The track-focused 155cc supersport with VVA, quick shifter, and dual-channel ABS. Features full LED lighting, LCD dash, and aggressive aerodynamics for ultimate performance.

image_urls.alt: Right profile showing aerodynamic fairing and quick shifter badge
Right profile showing aerodynamic fairing and quick shifter badge

cons: Aggressive riding position uncomfortable for city

faqs.question: Does R15 V4 have a quick shifter?
faqs.answer: Yes, comes with standard quick shifter for clutchless gear changes.

faqs.question: How much faster than V3?
faqs.answer: 0-60kmph in 2.9s vs 3.0s (V3) due to improved gear ratios.

faqs.question: Does it have Bluetooth?
faqs.answer: Yes, Y-Connect app shows calls, mileage stats and maintenance alerts.

faqs.question: Is it good for tall riders?
faqs.answer: Challenging - 815mm seat height suits average height riders best.

name: Yamaha R15 V4 Intensity White

faqs.answer: Identical: 0-60kmph in 2.9s, 0-100kmph in 6.5s.

faqs.question: Does it cost more to maintain?
faqs.answer: Only body panels cost more; mechanicals same as standard.

name: Yamaha R15 V4 Racing Blue

High resale value for classic scheme

faqs.answer: Only cosmetic - same performance (0-60kmph in 2.9s).

faqs.answer: No, but production may be limited by demand.

faqs.question: Does it have special badging?
faqs.answer: Yes, features Racing Blue logos on fairing.

faqs.question: Are wheels different?
faqs.answer: No, same alloy wheels as standard in silver.

name: Yamaha R15M
meta_title: Yamaha R15M – Premium 155cc Track Machine
meta_description: R15M: Exclusive badging, 0-60 in 2.8s, quick shifter & dual-ABS. The ultimate expression of R15 performance.
short_description: Yamaha R15M - The premium variant of R15 V4 with special M badging, metallic paints, and enhanced features. Ultimate 155cc track machine with quick shifter and dual-channel ABS.

faqs.question: What makes R15M special?
faqs.answer: Premium badging, metallic paints, and slightly tuned engine (0-60kmph in 2.8s).

faqs.question: Does it have performance upgrades?
faqs.answer: Marginally better acceleration due to ECU tuning.

faqs.question: Is it worth extra over V4?
faqs.answer: Only for enthusiasts wanting exclusive looks and slight performance edge.

faqs.question: Does it have special parts?
faqs.answer: Cosmetic differences only; mechanicals same as V4.

name: Yamaha R15M TFT Color Meter

faqs.question: What's special about the TFT display?
faqs.answer: Features multiple themes, gear position indicator, and better visibility in sunlight.

faqs.question: Performance same as standard R15M?

faqs.question: Does it have riding modes?
faqs.answer: No, but display shows fuel efficiency and performance metrics.

faqs.question: Is it worth the premium?
faqs.answer: Only for enthusiasts wanting the best instrumentation in 155cc class.

faqs.answer: Gets unique rally-inspired graphics and sporty decals.

meta_description: Saluto 125 delivers 58–62 kmpl, low cost & reliable performance. Simple, efficient transport for everyday riders.

faqs.answer: No, uses carburetor system for cost efficiency.

faqs.question: Does it have ABS?
faqs.answer: No, comes with basic drum brakes front and rear.

faqs.question: Suitable for highway?
faqs.answer: Best for city use; can do highways but limited to 85kmph comfortably.

faqs.question: Maintenance costs?
faqs.answer: Very affordable with cheap spare parts availability.

name: Yamaha Saluto 125 (UBS)

meta_description: Most affordable Yamaha with UBS braking, 58–62 kmpl & rugged commuter design. Safety meets value.

faqs.answer: Unified Braking System links front and rear brakes for better stopping power.

faqs.answer: No, UBS is different from ABS but improves braking balance.

faqs.answer: Budget-conscious buyers needing basic reliable transportation.

short_description: Suzuki Gixxer Carburetor - The 155cc street bike with carbureted engine and sporty design. Features oil-cooled performance and aggressive streetfighter styling at an affordable price point.

image_urls.alt: Suzuki Gixxer SF Fi ABS Back View

faqs.question: Difference between carb and FI?
faqs.answer: Carburetor version is cheaper but less efficient than fuel injection.

faqs.question: Does it have ABS?
faqs.answer: No, this variant comes without ABS.

faqs.question: Cold start issues?
faqs.answer: Carburetor may need choke in cold weather unlike FI.

faqs.question: Suitable for highway?
faqs.answer: Yes, comfortable up to 100-110kmph.

name: Suzuki Gixxer Fi Disc
meta_title: Suzuki Gixxer Fi Disc – Fuel-Injected 155cc Dual Disc
meta_description: Gixxer Fi Disc: Smoother FI engine, dual disc brakes & LED lighting. Better efficiency & braking than carb version.
short_description: Suzuki Gixxer Fi Disc - The fuel-injected 155cc street bike with dual disc brakes. Features improved throttle response, better efficiency, and sporty performance over carbureted version.

image_urls.alt: Suzuki Gixxer SF Fi ABS Back View
Suzuki Gixxer SF Fi ABS Front View

faqs.question: Benefits over carburetor?
faqs.answer: Better throttle response, efficiency and requires less maintenance.

faqs.question: Does it have ABS?
faqs.answer: No, this variant has dual discs but no ABS.

faqs.question: Cold start performance?
faqs.answer: FI provides better cold starts than carburetor.

faqs.question: Worth extra over carb?
faqs.answer: Yes, for better performance and lower maintenance.

name: Suzuki Gixxer Fi ABS
meta_title: Suzuki Gixxer Fi ABS – 155cc with Front ABS
meta_description: Gixxer Fi ABS adds single-channel ABS to fuel-injected 155cc. Safer braking without compromising performance.
short_description: Suzuki Gixxer Fi ABS - The top variant of Gixxer with fuel injection and single-channel ABS. Combines 155cc oil-cooled performance with safety features for confident riding.

image_urls.alt: Suzuki Gixxer SF Fi ABS Back View
Suzuki Gixxer SF Fi ABS Front View

faqs.question: Is ABS single or dual-channel?
faqs.answer: Single-channel ABS only on front wheel.

faqs.question: Performance same as non-ABS?
faqs.answer: Identical performance: 0-60kmph in 4.5s.

faqs.question: Worth extra over non-ABS?
faqs.answer: Yes, for safety especially in wet conditions.

faqs.question: Does it have traction control?
faqs.answer: No, only comes with ABS.

name: Suzuki Intruder Fi ABS
meta_title: Suzuki Intruder Fi ABS – 155cc Power Cruiser
meta_description: Intruder: Low 740mm seat, cruiser stance, ABS & LED projector. Bold style for relaxed, confident riding.
short_description: Suzuki Intruder Fi ABS - The 155cc power cruiser with muscular styling and relaxed ergonomics. Features fuel injection, single-channel ABS, and distinctive cruiser character.

image_urls.alt: Suzuki Intruder Fi ABS Suzuki Iintruder Fi Abs Showeoom View
Suzuki Intruder Fi ABS Back View
Suzuki Intruder Fi ABS Front View
Suzuki Intruder Fi ABS Left View
Suzuki Intruder Fi ABS Right View

faqs.question: Is this a proper cruiser?
faqs.answer: Yes, with forward-set footpegs and low seat height.

faqs.question: Performance vs Gixxer?
faqs.answer: Slower (0-60kmph in 5.2s) due to weight and gearing.

faqs.question: Does it have ABS?
faqs.answer: Yes, single-channel ABS on front wheel.

faqs.question: Suitable for tall riders?
faqs.answer: Best for average height due to footpeg position.

name: New Suzuki Gixxer SF Fi ABS
meta_title: Suzuki Gixxer SF Fi ABS – Fully-Faired 155cc Sports
meta_description: Gixxer SF Fi ABS: Full fairing, dual-channel ABS & 0-60 in 4.3s. Sporty looks with enhanced safety.
short_description: New Suzuki Gixxer SF Fi ABS - The fully-faired sports version of Gixxer with dual-channel ABS. Features aggressive aerodynamics, fuel injection, and track-inspired styling.

image_urls.alt: New Suzuki Gixxer SF Fi ABS on showroom display with full fairing and sporty stance

faqs.question: Difference from naked Gixxer?
faqs.answer: Adds full fairing, dual-channel ABS and sportier ergonomics.

faqs.question: How much faster than naked?
faqs.answer: Marginally quicker: 0-60kmph in 4.3s vs 4.5s.

faqs.question: Does it have riding modes?
faqs.answer: No, but dual-channel ABS improves safety.

faqs.question: Suitable for track days?
faqs.answer: Yes, with sporty ergonomics and fairing.

name: Suzuki Gixxer SF Matt Plus
meta_title: Suzuki Gixxer SF Matt Plus – Premium Matte 155cc
meta_description: Exclusive matte-finish Gixxer SF with dual-channel ABS & 0-60 in 4.2s. Stand out with premium sports styling.
short_description: Suzuki Gixxer SF Matt Plus - The premium edition of Gixxer SF with matte finish colors, dual-channel ABS, and sporty full-fairing design. Offers aggressive styling with 155cc oil-cooled performance.

image_urls.alt: Suzuki Gixxer SF Matt Plus on showroom display with matte finish and full fairing

faqs.question: What makes Matt Plus special?
faqs.answer: Premium matte paint scheme and dual-tone colors.

faqs.question: Performance same as standard SF?
faqs.answer: Nearly identical: 0-60kmph in 4.2s vs 4.3s.

faqs.question: Does it have traction control?
faqs.answer: No, but dual-channel ABS provides safety.

faqs.question: Is it worth the premium?
faqs.answer: Only for buyers wanting exclusive matte colors.

name: Suzuki Gixxer 250
meta_title: Suzuki Gixxer 250 – 248cc Oil-Cooled Naked Bike
meta_description: Gixxer 250: 26.5 PS, dual-channel ABS & 0-60 in 3.8s. Strong street performance in a premium naked package.
short_description: Suzuki Gixxer 250 - The powerful 250cc street naked with oil-cooled engine and aggressive streetfighter styling. Delivers strong performance with 26.5 PS power and premium features.
pros: Wider rear tire for better grip

faqs.question: How much faster than 155cc?
faqs.answer: Significantly quicker: 0-60kmph in 3.8s vs 4.3s.

faqs.question: Does it have dual-channel ABS?
faqs.answer: Yes, comes with dual-channel ABS as standard.

faqs.question: Suitable for highway touring?
faqs.answer: Yes, but small tank limits range.

faqs.question: Maintenance costs?
faqs.answer: Higher than 150cc but reasonable for 250cc.

name: Suzuki Gixxer SF 250
meta_title: Suzuki Gixxer SF 250 – Fully-Faired 250cc Sports Bike
meta_description: Gixxer SF 250: Full fairing, 26.5 PS & 0-60 in 3.7s. Track-inspired design with dual-channel ABS.
short_description: Suzuki Gixxer SF 250 - The fully-faired 250cc sports bike with aggressive aerodynamics and track-inspired design. Features dual-channel ABS, LED lighting, and 26.5 PS oil-cooled engine.

faqs.answer: No, but gearbox is smooth for clutchless shifts.

faqs.question: Suitable for track days?
faqs.answer: Yes, with sporty ergonomics and fairing.

faqs.question: Worth extra over naked?
faqs.answer: Yes, for sportier looks and slightly better performance.

faqs.question: How does it compare to R15?
faqs.answer: More premium with dual-channel ABS and quicker acceleration (0-60kmph in 3.5s vs 3.0s).

faqs.answer: Only for buyers wanting GSX-R badge and premium features.
